meanings.definition: A light-sensitive pigment found in the retina of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The retinene in the eye helps us see in dim light.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how retinene reacts to light to understand vision better.
meanings.sent3: The retinene in the eye must be on vacation; I can't see a thing in this dark room!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like retinene in the dark, full of light and life.
meanings.sent5: The retinene in the eye is like a tiny light bulb, illuminating the world around us.

meanings.definition: A derivative of vitamin A that is essential for vision.
meanings.sent1: Eating carrots provides the body with retinene, which is good for the eyes.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended foods rich in retinene to improve the patient's vision.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mistook retinene for a vitamin A tablet and tried to eat it!
meanings.sent4: Her vision cleared up as if a dose of retinene had been added to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The retinene in our bodies is like a superhero, fighting off vision problems and keeping us seeing clearly.
